author: Michael Larabel
description: In addition to the releases today of updated Endeavour OS and CachyOS, Solus 4.8 is out as the latest version of another desktop Linux distribution popular with enthusiasts...
title: Solus Linux 4.8 Released With Python 2 Finally Removed, Abandons Solus Software Center

author: Michael Larabel
description: With the Linux 6.18 stable kernel release expected to take place tomorrow on 30 November, here is a reminder about some of the new hardware support and other interesting features coming in this next stable version of the Linux kernel...
title: Linux 6.18 Features From Apple M2 To Sheaves, DM-PCACHE & More Intel + AMD Hardware

author: Michael Larabel
description: For those looking to improve their clipboard management experience on the GNOME desktop, Copyous is a new GNOME Shell extension serving as a new clipboard manager...
title: GNOME Gains New Clipboard Manager Option With "Copyous"

author: Michael Larabel
description: Endeavour OS is one of the popular desktop Linux distributions built around Arch Linux providing a nice out-of-the-box experience. Since their last ISO refresh back in March there hadn't been much news from the project nor any new ISO releases for this rolling-release distro. But thankfully today they are back in the saddle with a new ISO release, Endeavour OS 2025.11.24 "Ganymede"...
title: Arch Linux Based Endeavour OS Updated After ISO Refresh Hiatus

author: Michael Larabel
description: With the Linux Vendor Firmware Service serving more than 135 million downloads for Linux users updating their system and device firmware, LVFS has been working to get more hardware vendors to contribute either engineering resources or directly contributing annual dues as sponsors. Framework Computer is now the first one to have executed an agreement under these new sponsorship efforts...
title: Framework Computer Now Sponsoring LVFS / Fwupd Development

author: Michael Larabel
description: While there have been a number of Intel Linux engineers laid off over roughly the past year, other Linux kernel engineers opting to pursue employment opportunities elsewhere amid the ongoing challenges and restructuring at the company, and shifts in their open-source strategy, there's some good news as we work toward the 2025 holidays. Intel is currently hiring for two more experienced Linux kernel software engineers...
title: Intel Hiring Two More Experienced Linux Kernel Engineers

author: Michael Larabel
description: KDE developers have been busy ending out the month of November with a number of new features and fixes queued up for next year's Plasma 6.6 desktop release...
title: KDE Plasma 6.6's KWin Implements RandR Emulation For Better XWayland Experience

author: Michael Larabel
description: Niri 25.11 is now available as the latest feature release for this Rust-written, scrollable-tiling Wayland compositor...
title: Niri 25.11 Rust-Written Wayland Compositor Adds Alt-Tab Switcher, New Animations
